author: Adam Falk
title: Figure Skatingâ€™s Six Jumps Explained
text:
When a figure skater takes flight from the ice, their direction, the side of the blade they are favoring and whether or not they use their toe pick are what separate a Lutz from a Salchow or any other kind of jump.
These differences can easily escape the untrained eye. Olympian Jason Brown, however, is quite trained. He was part of the bronze medal-winning figure skating team in Sochi in 2014.
